intro: Micranthera, commonly known as the small-flowered shrub, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. These plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. They are characterized by their small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The genus includes several species, many of which are used in traditional medicine. Micranthera plants play an important role in their native ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
